comments:
Turn off web server on a remote machine.
Run debugger against this server.
There is no GUI message displayed that the connection can not be established.
Exception thrown:
- Unexpected exception communicating with server
- org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Unable to connect to Web Server. Web Server may not be started. 
	at org.eclipse.php.debug.core.debugger.PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.connect(PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.php.debug.core.debugger.PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.debug(PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.java:50)
	at org.eclipse.php.debug.core.launching.PHPServerLaunchDelegate.runPHPWebServer(PHPServerLaunchDelegate.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.php.debug.core.launching.PHPServerLaunchDelegate$RunDispatchJobWebServer.run(PHPServerLaunchDelegate.java:175)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Fixed
A message is now displayed.
Also, we have to force the termination of the ILaunch because at this stage of 
debug / run there is no
PHPDebugTarget, thus, we create a dummy debug target to overcome this issue and 
terminate the launch.

The message appears, but it's not correctly designed: "Unable to connect to Web 
Server. Web Server may not be started."
It's should be "Unable to connect to Web Server. Web Server can not be started. 
"

No.
We do not start the server when a debug / run is triggered. 
The server should be already online when a session is starting, thus, the 
message we display is the right one.

Changing the phrase to:
"The server might not have been started"

There is still exception thrown:
org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugException: Unable to connect to Web Server. The 
server might not have been started. 
	at 
org.eclipse.php.debug.core.debugger.PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.connect(PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.java:59)
	at 
org.eclipse.php.debug.core.debugger.PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.debug(PHPWebServerDebuggerInitializer.java:44)
	at 
org.eclipse.php.debug.core.launching.PHPServerLaunchDelegate.runPHPWebServer(PHPServerLaunchDelegate.java:107)
	at 
org.eclipse.php.debug.core.launching.PHPServerLaunchDelegate$RunDispatchJobWebServer.run(PHPServerLaunchDelegate.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

If entering a URL with webserver Live, but debug server is not available, there 
is exception thrown:

Error
Mon Jul 03 15:50:17 IDT 2006
Unable to connect to URL 
http://www.google.com/newfile.php?original_url=http://www.google.com/newfile.php&debug_protocol=2006040701&debug_port=10000&start_debug=1&debug_no_cache=1151931017660&debug_host=192.168.99.1%2C172.16.117.1%2C10.1.3.45%2C127.0.0.1&debug_session_id=1006&send_sess_end=1

java.io.FileNotFoundException: 
http://www.google.com/newfile.php?original_url=http://www.google.com/newfile.php&debug_protocol=2006040701&debug_port=10000&start_debug=1&debug_no_cache=1151931017660&debug_host=192.168.99.1%2C172.16.117.1%2C10.1.3.45%2C127.0.0.1&debug_session_id=1006&send_sess_end=1
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at 
sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:39)

	at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:494)

sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection$6.run(HttpURLConnection.java:1202)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: 
http://www.google.com/newfile.php?original_url=http://www.google.com/newfile.php&debug_protocol=2006040701&debug_port=10000&start_debug=1&debug_no_cache=1151931017660&debug_host=192.168.99.1%2C172.16.117.1%2C10.1.3.45%2C127.0.0.1&debug_session_id=1006&send_sess_end=1

	... 4 more

The logging of the connection error is not a bug. 
If you try to connect to a missing page or to a server without a debugger you 
will get an error indication. The logging of the error is done for more 
detailed information and debugging purposes.

traces.message: Unable to connect to Web Server. Web Server may not be started.
Unable to connect to Web Server. The  server might not have been started.
